page.title: 13Churches in Chatteris
page.content: There are a range of Christian churches. These include Baptist, Zion Baptist, Salvation Army, United Reformed, Methodists and Roman Catholic. The Benedictine Abbey mentioned in the original Domesday Survey no longer exists but the church connected with it does - the Church of St Peter and St Paul. The oldest known part is the base of the church tower. Most of the present church dates from after 1300 when the original building was destroyed by fire and had to be rebuilt. There was a further extensive restoration in 1910. Each year the members of the church have to raise around Â£10,000. This helps to pay the vicar's salary and the running costs of the church itself eg heating. Any money needed for further restoration has to be raised in addition.
